Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) A routine medical treatment for headaches after concussion.
B) A Phase II Randomized Controlled Double-Blind Clinical Trial for headache treatment after concussion.
C) A general survey about headache prevalence in the general population.
D) An educational seminar on the management of concussion symptoms.

Correct answer: B) A Phase II Randomized Controlled Double-Blind Clinical Trial for headache treatment after concussion.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected duration of participation for each subject in the "A Phase II Randomized Controlled Double-Blind Clinical Trial of Sphenopalatine Ganglion Blocks for Headache after Concussion" study?
A) 1 week
B) 2 weeks
C) 1 month
D) 3 months

Correct answer: B) 2 weeks

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research study "A Phase II Randomized Controlled Double-Blind Clinical Trial of Sphenopalatine Ganglion Blocks for Headache after Concussion"?

A) Participants will be responsible for all medical costs associated with the study, including the sphenopalatine ganglion block procedure.
B) The study will cover all costs, and participants will not incur any additional expenses.
C) Participants or their health plan will pay for regular care costs, but the study will cover research-related items or services.
D) Participants will be billed for travel and accommodation expenses related to study visits.

Correct answer: C) Participants or their health plan will pay for regular care costs, but the study will cover research-related items or services.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What will participants be required to do as part of the study procedures according to the new consent form?
A) Attend weekly in-person therapy sessions for six months.
B) Complete a short online survey daily for a two-week period and attend one research study visit for the sphenopalatine ganglion block procedure.
C) Undergo a surgical procedure to implant a medical device.
D) Participate in a monthly group discussion about concussion symptoms for a year.

Correct answer: B) Complete a short online survey daily for a two-week period and attend one research study visit for the sphenopalatine ganglion block procedure.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures in the study is considered experimental?
A) Standard medical care for concussion as directed by your doctor
B) Daily online surveys about headache symptoms and severity
C) Sphenopalatine ganglion block with either lidocaine or placebo saline solution
D) Follow-up appointments at the concussion clinic

Correct answer: C

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the "A Phase II Randomized Controlled Double-Blind Clinical Trial of Sphenopalatine Ganglion Blocks for Headache after Concussion" study?
A) 10; B) 24; C) 50; D) 100
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk associated with participating in the "Sphenopalatine Ganglion Blocks for Headache after Concussion" study?
A) Temporary relief of headache symptoms; B) Temporary numbness of the nose and throat; C) Guaranteed improvement in concussion recovery; D) Permanent alteration of taste sensation

Correct answer: B) Temporary numbness of the nose and throat

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the potential benefits of participating in the "Sphenopalatine Ganglion Blocks for Headache after Concussion" study?

A) Participants will definitely experience relief from their concussion-related headaches.
B) Participants may or may not experience improvements in headache after concussion, and the results could help establish new treatments for headaches due to concussion in the future.
C) Participants will receive financial compensation for the complete cure of their concussion-related headaches.
D) Participants are guaranteed to benefit from the new treatment being tested in the study.

Correct answer: B) Participants may or may not experience improvements in headache after concussion, and the results could help establish new treatments for headaches due to concussion in the future.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained

For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury or sickness as a result of participating in the "Sphenopalatine Ganglion Blocks for Headache after Concussion" study, who will be responsible for the medical costs associated with your treatment?

A) The study will cover all medical costs related to the injury or sickness.
B) You or your insurance provider will be billed for the treatment costs, as the study does not provide compensation for injury or sickness caused by the study.
C) The National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke will directly pay for any treatments required.
D) The University of Michigan will provide free treatment for any study-related injuries or sickness.

Correct answer: B) You or your insurance provider will be billed for the treatment costs, as the study does not provide compensation for injury or sickness caused by the study.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience an injury or have a concern related to your participation in the study, whom should you contact?

A) The Institutional Review Board (IRBMED); B) The Principal Investigator or Study Coordinator; C) The nearest Emergency Room; D) The University of Michigan Health System Compliance Help Line

Correct answer: B) The Principal Investigator or Study Coordinator

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What will happen if you decide to withdraw from the study after initially agreeing to participate?
A) You will incur a penalty for withdrawing.
B) You will lose benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
C) You may withdraw at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
D) Your withdrawal will automatically enroll you in a different study.

Correct answer: C) You may withdraw at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
